com.tabuto.util
Class Vettore

java.lang.Object
  com.tabuto.util.Vettore
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Vettore
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Vettore

Vettore is a class that represents a Vector in the 2D Cartesian Plane.

Each Vettore has:

  • module
  • direction
  • origin
  • end
  • Two components: i and j

By Default every Vettore live in a Cartesian Plane with origin's coordinate point setting by default in the high left corner. But you can change the JRif boolean value to false to accepts negative values coordinates by add it at the end of Constructor parameters.

You can add Vettore to each other using the add(Vettore) method, or setting a new position using appropriate methods.
N.B.The Standard direction verse has a counterclockwise pattern:

  • North direction is 3*PI/2 or 270°
  • Est direction is 0.0 or 2*PI (0° or 360°)
  • South direction is PI/2 or 90°
  • West direction is PI or 180°

Version:
0.2.2
Author:
tabuto83

Field Detail

serialVersionUID

private static final long serialVersionUID
See Also:
Constant Field Values

origin

public Point origin
Origin Point of the vector

end

public Point end
End Point of the vector

JRif

protected boolean JRif
Flag to calculate the coordinate with the Java Standard: The origin Point (0,0) is setting on the high left corner.
So, the coordinates are therefore always positive values.
This flag is true by default

i

protected double i
The x coordinate's component

j

protected double j
The y coordinate's component

direction

protected double direction
Direction of the Vettore is expressed in radians; Direction has values between 0 and 2*Math.PI. The Standard direction verse has a counterclockwise pattern:
  • North direction is 3*PI/2 or 270°
  • Est direction is 0.0 or 2*PI (0° or 360°)
  • South direction is PI/2 or 90°
  • West direction is PI or 180°

module

protected double module
Vettore's module

verse

protected boolean verse
Indicate the current verse of Vettore; NOT YET USED

eps

private double eps
The current number error. This value is important to get consistent results beyond the error introduced by finite precision.
Default value is 0.00001 or 1x10E-5

See Also:
setPrecision(double), getPrecision()
